parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It mentions authors and books, but not candidates.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is designed to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals. The reach estimate is ">1M".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote books and a discussion about them. While the themes of liberty and democracy are touched upon, there is no explicit or implicit call to vote for or against any particular candidate or party. The content focuses on literature and a cultural event.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post could be considered a form of advertisement for a cultural event (a discussion about books related to liberty and democracy). It promotes a discussion on relevant societal themes, which could be considered within the realm of journalistic or citizen journalism, aiming to inform and educate the public.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it promotes a cultural event.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>502775732812107</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a discussion about books related to liberty and democracy.  While the themes are politically relevant, the post itself does not advocate for or against any specific candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections. The advertisement is for a cultural event, not a political campaign.  There is no call to action related to voting. The post does not meet the criteria of electoral propaganda as defined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The absence of a CMF number further supports this conclusion.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Editura Litera</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
